726927f-a.text:
Hoyt Avenue, west from 31st Street. All the houses on the north side (right) of the avenue were torn down in 1934 when that area was made part of the Grand Central Parkway approaoh to the Triborough Bridge. View 8 shows the buildings being
demolished.
P. L. Sperr  View 1: March 13, 1931
NO REPRODUCTIONS  View 2: August 3, 1934

726930f-a.text:
Hoyt Avenue, north side, east from 3lst Street to Astoria Boulevard, showing the area in a set of three views. View 1 shows the buildings at the N.E. corner of 31st Street, with the I.R.T. 'El' on the latter; view 2 shows the adjoining buildings and where Hoyt Avenue (formerly 25th Avenue) meets Astoria Boulevard; view 3 shows the buildings at 32nd Street and the Astoria Boulevard trolley tracks. These buildings, among others, were rased in 1934 for the construction of the
Triborough Bridge approach.
P. L. Sperr  March 11, 1931
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Views 1,2,3

726926f-b.text:
Hoyt Avenue, at 31st Street, seen from 32nd Street (view 1) and 24th Road and showing the Hoyt Avenue (25th Avenue) '1' station; shown, too, are buildings being torn down for the construction of the Grand Central Parkway approach to the Triborough Bridge.
P. L. Sperr  September 20, 1934
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Views 1,2

726926f-a.text:
Hoyt Avenue, at 31st Street, seen from 32nd Street (view 1) and 24th Road and showing the Hoyt Avenue (25th Avenue) '1' station; shown, too, are buildings being torn down for the construction of the Grand Central Parkway approach to the Triborough Bridge.
P. L. Sperr  September 20, 1934
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Views 1,2

726928f-a.text:
Hoyt Avenue (left), west from 31st Street, viewing across the area where numerous houses were demolished (center) for the construction of the Grand Central Parkway approach to the Triborough Bridge.
Views 2 and S are across the same area, at a later date, and show the bridge under construction. Only buildings on the
north side of Hoyt Avenue were torn down.
P. L. Sperr  View 1 September 20, 1934
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Views 2,3: June 12, 1935

725203f-a.text:
31st Street, west side, between Hoyt Avenue and 24th Avenue, vlewipg north and showing a recently constructed playground. ~n the background is the Hellgate Bridge.
P. L. Sperr  June 24, 1937
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Views 1,2

726924f-b.text:
Hoyt Avenue, at the N.W. corner of 31st Street, showing several of a row of frame houses. These were later demolished when the north side of the avenue became the vehicular approach to the Triborough Bridge.
Views 2 and 3 show the houses just prior to demolition.
P. L. Sperr  View 1I March 6, 1931
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Views 2,3r September 20, 1934

726925f-b.text:
Hoyt Avenue, at 31at Street (vantage point), showing a view northwestward toward the Hellgate Bridge, from the Hoyt Avenue station of the "El." Some of the buildings seen here were later torn down when the area was made part of the Grand Central Parkway approach to the Triborough Bridge. The are in the immediate foreground extends to 29th Street; all the frame dwellings here were later raed. The brick homes
are on the west side of 29th Street.
View 2 shows the same area, viewed in the same direction,
at a later date.
P. L. Sperr  View 1: March 14, 1931
NO REPRODUCTIONS  View 2: June 12, 1935
